title: Boy & Bear: Limit Of Love review – crisp, risk-free folk-pop that will offend no one
text: Boy & Bear: Limit Of Love review – crisp, risk-free folk-pop that will offend no one Monday, 19 October 2015 (21 minutes ago) Sitting comfortably in the embrace of Australia’s music establishment, Boy & Bear fail to step outside of their radio-friendly safe zone on their third album When national radio broadcaster Triple J unearthed Boy & Bear in 2009, the zeitgeist snatched them up, up, up. Not only did their name feature a creature of the ...
